thread.title: Lions' Levy back walking after hip surgery
thread.title_full: Lions' Levy back walking after hip surgery

author: freep.com
title: Lions' Levy back walking after hip surgery
text:
MORE DeAndre Levy walked through a hallway at the Detroit Lions practice facility today, his surgically repaired hip showing no signs of the injury that's likely to keep him out for the rest of the regular season.
Levy did not talk to reporters beyond saying hello, but Lions coach Jim Caldwell said today that team's best linebacker underwent surgery last week and that the procedure was a success.
Levy strained a muscle in his hip in the preseason and has played just 17 regular-season snaps this year.
He missed the first four games of the season, returned briefly for a Week 5 loss to the Arizona Cardinals, but left in the first half of that game after aggravating his injury.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Lions' Joique Bell says return to the field is near
The Lions are expected to shut Levy down for the season, but Caldwell said no decision has been made yet on whether to place him on season-ending injured reserve.
Josh Bynes has made five starts in Levy's place this year.
